Human herpesvirus 6 (HHV-6) and 7 (HHV-7) are typically subclinical infections that may present as roseola or pityriasis rosea, respectively. Reactivation in transplant recipients has been reported to cause hepatitis, graft rejection, and liver failure alongside extrahepatic manifestations including colitis, pneumonitis, encephalitis, and bone marrow suppression.
69 Tissue biopsy with viral PCR is available but not standardized, and positive results do not necessarily confirm causation of clinical disease.
